Use GitHub actions for packages

Source: R/use_pkg_actions.R
use_pkg_actions.Rd

This function configures GitHub actions to check your package, build its website, and deploy it to gh-pages. By default, examples don't run. This is to avoid accidentally showing private data in examples. If you do want to run examples, edit ".github/workflows/main.yml" and replace pkgdown::build_site(examples = FALSE) with pkgdown::build_site(examples = TRUE).

use_pkg_actions()

Value

Invisible NULL.

Setup

  • Setup secrets at Settings > Secrets (available only if you have access to GitHub Actions):

    • You need GH_PAT for GitHub actions (https://github.com/maxheld83/ghpages#secrets).

    • If your package needs to access private repos, also add your GITHUB_PAT.

  • Use pkgdown with usethis::use_pkgdown() or from 2dii's template:

usethis::use_template("_pkgdown.yml", package = "r2dii.usethis")

  • Create the gh-pages branch from the terminal (instructions from pkgdown::deploy_site_github()):

git checkout --orphan gh-pages
git rm -rf .
git commit --allow-empty -m 'Initial gh-pages commit'
git push origin gh-pages
git checkout master

See also

usethis::use_pkgdown(), pkgdown::deploy_site_github().

Examples

if (FALSE) {
use_pkg_actions()
}
